definition: when things reach an extreme, they can only move in the opposite direction (idiom)
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system

sentences.english: I finally experience feeling of the old saying, " Too much water drowned the miller."
sentences.chinese: 我终于感受到那句俗话所说的感觉，“物极必反”。

sentences.english: But it can go too far.
sentences.chinese: 但是它也可能物极必反。

sentences.english: We don’t want to get too graphic here, but going overboard is kind of a turn off.
sentences.chinese: 我们不想要在这里太过露骨，但物极必反。

sentences.english: Like ice cream, too much of the pulse at once is a bad thing.
sentences.chinese: 像冰激凌，一旦有太多的冲动，就会物极必反。

sentences.english: That things turn for the worse when they reach the extreme seems not to be something which people take heed of.
sentences.chinese: 物极必反的道理，似乎很难在人们心中起警惕的效应。

definition: too far is as bad as not enough (idiom, from the Analects)
lit. to want sth in haste, but cannot get there (idiom, from Analects); more haste, less speed/don't try to run before you can walk
without destruction there can be no construction
to stop before going too far (idiom); to stop while one can/don't overdo it/stop while you're ahead
if you live a life of crime, sooner or later you'll pay for it
pinyin: chu1 lai2 hun4 chi2 zao3 yao4 huan2 de5

definition: No flower can bloom for a hundred days./Good times do not last long. (idiom)
to act with undue haste (idiom); eager and impatient/overhasty
a thing should not be attempted more than three times (idiom)/don't repeat the same mistake again and again/bad things don't happen more than three times
